title: Corporate balance sheets
description: The database of the Corporate Balance Sheets (Ustan) comprises annual financial statements of non-financial corporations and is formed in the context of the refinancing business.

title: Credit register of loans of €1.5 million or more
description: The credit register maintained by the Deutsche Bundesbank records all loans of 1.5 million Euro or more granted to a single borrower during the previous quarter and then notifies the lenders of the overall indebtedness of their borrowers.

title: Prudential information system
description: The credit register maintained by the Deutsche Bundesbank records all loans of 1.5 million Euro or more granted to a single borrower during the previous quarter and then notifies the lenders of the overall indebtedness of their borrowers.

title: Microdatabase Direct investment
description: The MiDi is a collection of individual (i.e. firm-to-firm or private individuals-to-firms) investment relations originally collected to calculate aggregate measures of German foreign direct investment (FDI).

title: Interest rates on deposits and loans
description: The data are collected within the framework of the MFI interest rate statistics on a harmonised basis in the euro area since January 2003, fulfilling the requirements of Regulation ECB/2001/18.

title: Statistics on International Trade in Services
description: Germany’s Statistics on International Trade in Services are collected by the Deutsche Bundesbank in order to compile Germany’s Balance of Payments Statistics and serve as the basis for the research dataset SITS.

provider: RAND Center for the Study of Aging
title: Health and Retirement Study

provider: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
title: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey
description: The National Health and Nutrition Examination Surveys (Cycle I) were designed to measure the nutritional status and health of the U.S. population aged 1-74 years and to obtain more detailed information on the health status and medical care needs of adults aged 25-74 years in the civilian noninstitutionalized population.

provider: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
title: NHANES 1 Epidemiologic Follow-up Study
description: The National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey I Epidemiologic Followup Study (NHEFS) originated as a joint project between the National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) and the National Institute on Aging (NIA).

title: Established Populations for Epidemiologic Studies of the Elderly
description: The goals of the Established Populations for Epidemiologic Studies of the Elderly (EPESE) project were to describe and identify predictors of mortality, hospitalization, and placement in long-term care facilities and to investigate risk factors for chronic diseases and loss of functioning.

title: Elections to the United States House of Representatives
description: This data collection, designed to facilitate analysis of voting behavior at the district level and the effect of party incumbency on election outcomes, contains election returns for elections to the United States House of Representatives from 1898 to 1992.

title: The Anatomical Tracings of Lesions after Stroke
description: The Anatomical Tracings of Lesions After Stroke (ATLAS) Dataset - Release 1.2 is an open-source data collection consisting a total of 304 T1-weighted MRIs (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) with manually segmented diverse lesions and metadata.

title: Johns Hopkins University Prevention Research Center - Risks for Transitions in Drug Use Among Urban Adults, Baltimore City, 2008-2011
description: The Johns Hopkins University Prevention Research center - Risks for Transitions, Baltimore city, 2008-2011 study (JHU PRC Risks for Transition in Drug Use among Urban Adults) represents data collected for a 25 years follow-up from the original JHU PRC study.

title: Monthly Retail Trade Surveys
description: The Advance Monthly and Monthly Retail Trade Surveys (MARTS and MRTS), the Annual Retail Trade Survey (ARTS), and the Quarterly E-Commerce Report work together to produce the most comprehensive data available on retail economic activity in the United States.

title: Consumer Expenditure Surveys
description: The Consumer Expenditure Surveys (CE) program provides data on expenditures, income, and demographic characteristics of consumers in the United States. The CE program provides these data in tables, LABSTAT database, news releases, reports, and public use microdata files.

title: FoodAPS National Household Food Acquisition and Purchase Survey
alt_title: National Household Food Acquisition and Purchase Survey
description: USDA's National Household Food Acquisition and Purchase Survey (FoodAPS) is the first nationally representative survey of American households to collect unique and comprehensive data about household food purchases and acquisitions.

title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program
description: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) Data System provides time-series data on State and county-level estimates of SNAP participation and benefit levels, combined with area estimates of total population and the number of persons in poverty.

title: Survey of Income and Program Participation
description: SIPP is the premier source of information for income and program participation. SIPP collects data and measures change for many topics including: economic well-being, family dynamics, education, assets, health insurance, childcare, and food security.

title: Nielsen TDLinx
description: This database contains information on individual store characteristics for supermarkets, supercenters, superettes, convenience stores and grocery kiosks.

title: NPD ReCount
description: This database contains information on individual store characteristics for supermarkets, supercenters, superettes, convenience stores and grocery kiosks.

title: National Establishment Time Series
description: The National Establishment Time Series (NETS) is a private sector source of U.S. business microdata.

title: Nielsen Homescan
description: Contains information on household based purchases for about 400,000 UPC’s and non-UPC coded random weight items, including prices, quantities, purchase date, product attributes, store name, store format, and zip code.

title: Food and Nutrition Service Program Data
description: The Program Data site provides selected statistical information on activity in all major Food and Nutrition Service Programs (FNS). These include the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP); the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children (WIC); child nutrition programs (National School Lunch, School Breakfast, Child and Adult Care, Summer Food Service and Special Milk); and food distribution programs (Schools, Emergency Food Assistance, Indian Reservations, Commodity Supplemental, Nutrition for the Elderly, and Charitable Institutions).

title: Current Population Survey Food Security Supplement
description: The Current Population Survey Food Security Supplement (CPS-FSS) is the source of national and State-level statistics on food insecurity used in USDA's annual reports on household food security.

title: Cost Estimates of Foodborne Illnesses
description: The Cost Estimates of Foodborne Illnesses data product provides detailed data about the costs of major foodborne illnesses in the United States, updating and extending previous ERS research.

title: Food Access Research Atlas
description: The FARA presents a spatial overview of food access indicators for low-income and other census tracts using different measures of supermarket accessibility; Provides food access data for populations within census tracts; and Offers census-tract-level data on food access that can be downloaded for community planning or research purposes.

title: Food Availability Data System - Loss-adjusted food availability
description: The ERS Food Availability (Per Capita) Data System (FADS) includes three distinct but related data series on food and nutrient availability for consumption: food availability data, loss-adjusted food availability data, and nutrient availability data.

title: Food Intakes Converted to Retail Commodities Databases
description: Food Intakes Converted to Retail Commodities Databases (FICRCD) provide data for foods consumed in the United States national dietary intake surveys at the retail commodity level.

title: Continuing Surveys of Food Intakes by Individuals
description: The CSFII is a nationwide survey conducted by USDA’s Agricultural Research Service that provides the food intakes of 20,607 individuals of all ages on two nonconsecutive days. Data collection in 1994 to 1996 included individuals of all ages. The supplemental survey conducted in 1998 included children from birth to 9 years of age.

title: Operational and Administrative System for Import Support
description: The Operational and Administrative System for Import Support, known as OASIS, is an automated FDA system for processing and making admissibility determinations for shipments of foreign-origin FDA-regulated products seeking to enter domestic commerce.

title: Food Safety and Inpection Service Program Data
School Food Authority Characteristics Study
description: Data were obtained from the School Food Authority Characteristics Study (SFACS), a nationally representative survey of public SFAs that was stratified to allow estimates by region and urbanicity. The survey was administered by USDA’s Food and Nutrition Service.

title: School Nutrition Dietary Assessment Study
description: Data were obtained from the School Food Authority Characteristics Study (SFACS), a nationally representative survey of public SFAs that was stratified to allow estimates by region and urbanicity. The survey was administered by USDA’s Food and Nutrition Service.

title: Quarterly Food-at-Home Price Database
description: The Quarterly Food-at-Home Price Database (QFAHPD) provides food price data to support research on the economic determinants of food consumption, diet quality, and health outcomes.

title: American Community Survey
description: The American Community Survey (ACS) helps local officials, community leaders, and businesses understand the changes taking place in their communities.

title: Current Population Survey Annual Social and Economic Supplement
description: The Current Population Survey Food Security Supplement (CPS-FSS) is the source of national and State-level statistics on food insecurity used in USDA's annual reports on household food security.

title: Food Security Questionnaire
description: The Current Population Survey Food Security Supplement (CPS-FSS) is the source of national and State-level statistics on food insecurity used in USDA's annual reports on household food security.

title: Food Security Survey Module
description: https://www.ers.usda.gov/topics/food-nutrition-assistance/food-security-in-the-us/survey-tools.aspx#household.

provider: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
title: National Health Interview Survey Family Food Security Supplement
description: The Family Food Security (FFS) section, sponsored by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), consists of 10 questions addressing adult 30-day food security. The purpose of the questions is to examine the relationship between health and food insecurity.

provider: Intitute for Research on Poverty at the University of Wisconsin–Madison
title: Multi-Sample Person File
description: The MSPF was created by drawing on information extracts from the full universe of clients or participants in the State of Wisconsin’s electronically available administrative data on public assistance, child support, child welfare, unemployment benefits, and incarceration, and merging them to create a single file of unique individuals.

title: Current Population Survey
description: The Current Population Survey (CPS), sponsored jointly by the U.S. Census Bureau and the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), is the primary source of labor force statistics for the population of the United States.

provider: State of Wisconsin Department of Workforce Development
title: Wisconsin Unemployment Insurance
description: The UI Data Summary is produced quarterly from state-reported data contained in the Unemployment Insurance Data Base (UIDB) as well as UI-related data from outside sources (e.g., Bureau of Labor Statistics data on employment and unemployment and U.S. Department of Treasury data on state UI trust fund activities).

title: Supplemental Security Income
description: The Supplemental Security Income (SSI) program is a nationwide federal assistance program administered by the Social Security Administration (SSA) that guarantees a minimum level of income for needy aged, blind, or disabled individuals.

provider: Wisconsin Department of Children and Families
title: Wisconsin Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Wisconsin Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Wisconsin provides several types of Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) programs, including the Wisconsin Works (W-2) program, in addition to programs which are partially or wholly funded through State funds.

title: Wisconsin Department of Corrections
description: The dataset includes adult prison statistics, community supervision statistics, data on youthful offenders, staff assault and injury reports, and recidivism and reincarceration rates.

title: Department of Public Instruction
description: The Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction, headquartered in Madison, is the state education and public library management agency in the state of Wisconsin.

title: College Enrollment
description: Thousands of high schools currently use StudentTracker® reports from the Research Center to measure how many of their graduates go on to college, where they attend, and how many persist to graduation. The reports were designed to help schools to measure their success in preparing students for college, and to evaluate the effectiveness of college access programs and curricula.

title: Integrated Public Use Microdata Series
description: IPUMS USA collects, preserves and harmonizes U.S. census microdata and provides easy access to this data with enhanced documentation. Data includes decennial censuses from 1790 to 2010 and American Community Surveys (ACS) from 2000 to the present.

title: Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance
description: Yearly data for Social Security beneficiary population - people receiving Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance (OASDI) benefits by state.

provider: Department of Health and Human Services
title: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families
description: TANF administrative records from the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), which collects them from various state agencies. States have the option to submit either sample or universe data to HHS, and 30 states submitted universe data.

provider: Department of Housing and Urban Development
title: Public and Indian Housing Information Center
description: The role of the Office of Public and Indian Housing is to ensure safe, decent, and affordable housing; create opportunities for residents' self-sufficiency and economic independence; and assure fiscal integrity by all program participants.

provider: Department of Housing and Urban Development
title: Tenant Rental Assistance Certification System
description: TRACS is a HUD computer system developed to help improve financial controls over assisted housing programs by automating manual procedures and incorporating automated controls.

title: IRS 1040 Forms
alt_title: Census Bureau extracts of IRS 1040 Forms
Census Bureau extracts of Internal Revenue Service 1040 Forms
description: Form 1040 is used by U.S. taxpayers to file an annual income tax return.

title: State of Michigan Unemployment Insurance
description: UI-related data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics data on employment and unemployment.

title: Detroit Work First
description: The Michigan Works! Association is a non-profit membership organization that supports the state's talent development system: Michigan Works!.

provider: Washington State Department of Social and Health Services
title: Washington Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Washington Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) provides temporary cash for families in need.

provider: Washington State Department of Social and Health Services
title: Washington Child support
description: Improve lives by delivering excellent child support services.

provider: New York State Office of Temporary and Disability Statistics
title: Temporary & Disability Assistance Statistics
description: The records are monthly payments from SNAP (food stamps), TANF and General Assistance.

title: Person Identification Validation System
description: The Census Bureau’s Person Identification Validation System (PVS) assigns unique person identifiers to federal, commercial, census, and survey data to facilitate linkages across and within files.

title: Wisconsin Child Support Demonstration Evaluation
description: The CSDE conducted by the Institute for Researach on Poverty, included several primary components: a statewide random assignment experimental evaluation; quantitative nonexperimental evaluations using Wisconsin and national data on child support policies; analyses of policy implementation and monitoring; and qualitative explorations of family dynamics and responses to the new state policies.

provider: Department of Health and Human Services
title: Welfare Rules Database
description: The Welfare Rules Database provides a comprehensive, sophisticated resource for anyone researching cash assistance programs in the U.S.

title: Youth Villages Transitional Living Program
description: The Youth Villages Transitional Living evaluation is using a rigorous random assignment design to measure what difference the program makes. Youth 18 years and older who spent one year in the Tennessee foster care system after age 14, or one day after age 17, and agree to participate in the study are assigned, at random, to a group that has access to Youth Villages Transitional Living services or to a group that has access to whatever transitional services are availabl in the community.

provider: Florida Department of Children and Families
title: Florida Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Florida Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) provides temporary cash for families in need.

title: Georgia Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Georgia Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) provides temporary cash for families in need.

provider: Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
title: Michigan Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Michigan Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) provides temporary cash for families in need.

provider: Ohio Department of Job and Family Services
title: Ohio Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Ohio Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) provides temporary cash for families in need.

provider: Ohio Department of Job and Family Services
title: State of Ohio Unemployment Insurance
description: UI-related data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics data on employment and unemployment.

title: State of Florida Unemployment Insurance
description: UI-related data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics data on employment and unemployment.

title: State of Georgia Unemployment Insurance
description: UI-related data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics data on employment and unemployment.

title: Integrated Client Database
alt_title: Washington State DSHS Integrated Client Database
description: DSHS’ INTEGRATED CLIENT DATABASE (ICDB) is a longitudinal client database containing over a decade of detailed service risks, history, costs, and outcomes.

title: Social Security Disability Insurance Program
description: Since 1956, the Social Security program has provided cash benefits to people with disabilities. This annual report provides program and demographic information about the people who receive those benefits.

title: Oregon Temporary Assistance to Needy Families
alt_title: Aid to Dependent Families with Children
Oregon Aid to Dependent Families with Children
description: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) provides temporary cash for families in need.

title: State of Oregon Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program
description: SNAP offers food benefits to eligible, low-income individuals and families.
